content.description: This is another great line found by Nick Reecy. The crux is testing your ability to pull on split bi-doigt pockets and crimps with off-center feet. The pockets are atypical of Unaweep and make this line a particular gem to those wishing to punch through. Syphilis is on impeccable/unique stone, that is free of STDs. The landing is easily protectable with pads and a spotter.
content.protection: Two or three pads and spotter.
content.location: This line is on the northeast overhanging face of The Interim Boulder. It starts on a nice three-finger slot and a right hand pinch-pull and opposing, non-positive feet. The climb then moves up left to the mono/bidoigt out left, then right to a crimp and an intermediate to a toothed mono-and-a-half before deadpointing to a mini-arete crimp and then firing to the apex jug. Choose your own adventure....

content.description: Sit start just right and below the large flake that severed from the main boulder on a left hand pocket and a right hand sidepull. From there, pull up to a pair of pockets, then traverse left (high dab potential coming around the flake) through the shallow, featured huecos. Upon reaching the far left huecos, head straight up for the finish.
content.protection: The landing is not bad, considering it consists of two tiers that are separated by at least three feet. I would still recommend three pads though.
content.location: It traverses the west face of Interim.

content.description:
Ode to Highway 141 is a short, power problem that climbs a slight overhang on a group of pockets and edges.

Sit start with any combination of the pockets which permits forward progress (I used a right hand sidepull and a left hand pinch). From there, reach a right hand edge along the seam, bump the left hand up to another pinch, then fire to the jug at the false lip, match hands, and work the juggy lip for a straightforward send.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine, the landing is flat and clear, but there is a rock off to the right that may be a factor with the dyno.
content.location: It climbs the northeast-facing overhang on Interim.
